page.title: 16 CAMMEL LAIRDS SHIPYARD
page.content: In{1857 Cammel Lairds Shipyard}moved to its present site, south of Woodside Ferry. The shipyard has always been a man source of{employment in this area. One reason for high {unemployment}here has been the decline of the yards. The new Cammel lairds opened in 1978. The{covered yard}is one of the{biggest buildings}of its kind. The hall is 145m long by 107m wide and 50m in height. The overhead cranes can lift 260 tonnes. The{ship {hall}can take two ships at a time. The hall is split into two bays. At the western end of the hall is the final assembly area. When a section is completed it is lifted onto an elevated slipway. Completed ships then pass through giant doors which slide back. {
